name: presentation
objective: launch fullscreen presentation mode in Impress
description: Check if Impress can launch a full screen presentation

steps.description: Click on "Applications" in the top bar
Click on the "Slide Show" top bar button
In the drop down menu, click on "Slide Show"

author: elebideau

name: scan
objective: Insert a picture by scanning from Impress
description: Check if the Impress application handles the scanning support
pre_condition: Have a scanning device installed on the system

steps.description: Click on "Applications" in the top bar
In the Impress window, click on "Insert"

author: elebideau

name: create-impress
description: Check for Impress starting properly

steps.description: Click on "Applications" in the top bar

author: elebideau

name: open-odp
objective: open an odp file with Impress
description: Check if Impress is able to open odp files
pre_condition: Have Impress started and have an odp file in the home directory

steps.description: Click on "File" on the top-left bar

steps.expected: The odp file is correctly opened in Impress

author: elebideau

name: open-ppt
objective: open a ppt file with Impress
description: Check if Impress is able to open ppt files
pre_condition: Have Impress started and have a ppt file in the home directory

steps.description: Click on "File" on the top-left bar

steps.expected: The ppt file is correctly opened in Impress

author: elebideau

name: open-pptx
objective: open a pptx file with Impress
description: Check if Impress is able to open pptx files
pre_condition: Have Impress started and have a pptx file in the home directory

steps.description: Click on "File" on the top-left bar

steps.expected: The pptx file is correctly opened in Impress

author: elebideau

name: edit
description: Check if Impress allows to edit documents
pre_condition: Have Impress started in foreground with an existing Impress document open

steps.description: Type some letters with the keyboard
steps.expected: The letters are printed on the Impress page

author: elebideau

name: save-odp
objective: save an odp file with Impress
description: Check if Impress allows to save odp documents
pre_condition: Have Impress started in foreground with an unsaved and edited document open

steps.description: Click on "File" on the top-left bar
Select "ODF Presentation (.odp)" with the "All formats" drop-down menu

steps.expected: The document has been correctly saved in odp format in the selected directory

author: elebideau

name: save-ppt
objective: save a ppt file with Impress
description: Check if Impress allows to save ppt documents
pre_condition: Have Impress started in foreground with an unsaved and edited document open

steps.description: Click on "File" on the top-left bar
Select "Microsoft PowerPoint 97/2000/XP/2003 (.ppt)" with the "All formats" drop-down menu

steps.expected: The document has been correctly saved in ppt format in the selected directory

author: elebideau

name: save-pptx
objective: save a pptx file with Impress
description: Check if Impress allows to save pptx documents
pre_condition: Have Impress started in foreground with an unsaved and edited document open

steps.description: Click on "File" on the top-left bar
Select "Microsoft PowerPoint 2007/2010 XML (.pptx)" with the "All formats" drop-down menu

steps.expected: The document has been correctly saved in pptx format in the selected directory

author: elebideau

name: slides
description: Check if Impress is able to create slides

steps.description: Click on the "Insert" tob bar button
Click on the "Insert" tob bar button
Select a picture in a directory

steps.expected: The picture is correctly inserted in the current slide of the presentation

steps.description: Click on the first slide shown on left side
steps.expected: The first slide is viewed in the main window

steps.description: Click a few times on left-mouse button
steps.expected: The slides are displayed in full screen mode one by one and the full screen mode ends when there is no more slide

author: elebideau

name: odp-ppt-conversion
description: Check if Impress is able to convert an odp file into a ppt file, and to convert this ppt file into an odp file while respecting the format
pre_condition: Have Impress started and have an odp file in the home directory

steps.description: Click on "File" on the top-left bar

steps.expected: The odp file is correctly opened in Impress

steps.description: Click on "File" on the top-left bar
Select "Microsoft PowerPoint 97/2000/XP/2003 (.ppt)" with the "All formats" drop-down menu
In the "Confirm File Format" window, click on "Use Microsoft PowerPoint 97/2000/XP/2003 Format"
steps.expected: The document has been correctly saved in ppt format in the selected directory

steps.description: Click on "File" on the top-left bar
Select the ppt file previously saved

steps.expected: The ppt file is correctly opened in Impress

steps.description: Click on "File" on the top-left bar
Select "ODF Presentation (.odp)" with the "All formats" drop-down menu

steps.expected: The document has been correctly saved in odp format in the selected directory and it is equal to the original odp file

author: elebideau

name: odp-pptx-conversion
description: Check if Impress is able to convert an odp file into a pptx file, and to convert this pptx file into an odp file while respecting the format
pre_condition: Have Impress started and have an odp file in the home directory

steps.description: Click on "File" on the top-left bar

steps.expected: The odp file is correctly opened in Impress

steps.description: Click on "File" on the top-left bar
Select "Microsoft PowerPoint 2007/2010 XML (.pptx)" with the "All formats" drop-down menu
In the "Confirm File Format" window, click on "Use Microsoft PowerPoint 2007/2010 XML Format"
steps.expected: The document has been correctly saved in pptx format in the selected directory

steps.description: Click on "File" on the top-left bar
Select the pptx file previously saved

steps.expected: The pptx file is correctly opened in Impress

steps.description: Click on "File" on the top-left bar
Select "ODF Presentation (.odp)" with the "All formats" drop-down menu

steps.expected: The document has been correctly saved in odp format in the selected directory and it is equal to the original odp file

author: elebideau

name: swf
objective: export LibreOffice Impress documents to SWF
pre_condition: Have Impress started in foreground with an existing Impress document (.odp) open

steps.description: Click on "File" on the top-left bar
Select "Macromedia Flash (.swf)" with the "All formats" drop-down menu

steps.expected: The presentation is correctly exported to the swf format

author: elebideau

name: multimedia-ogg
description: Check if Impress is able to insert ogg videos and to launch them into full screen presentation
pre_condition: Have GStreamer 1.0 support, an ogg file in the home directory, and Impress already started

steps.description: Click on "Insert" on the top bar
Select the ogg file in the home directory

steps.expected: The video is correctly inserted in the presentation slide
The presentation starts and the movie starts to play

author: elebideau

name: multimedia-mov
description: Check if Impress is able to insert mov videos and to launch them into full screen presentation
pre_condition: Have GStreamer 1.0 support, a mov file in the home directory, and Impress already started

steps.description: Click on "Insert" on the top bar
Select the mov file in the home directory

steps.expected: The video is correctly inserted in the presentation slide
The presentation starts and the movie starts to play

author: elebideau

name: presenter-console
objective: presenter console integrated as core feature
description: Check if the presenter console is integrated as core feature in Impress

steps.description: Click on "Tools" in the top bar
In the drop-down menu, click on "Extension Manager..."
Check if there is no extension called "Presenter Console"

steps.expected: The presentation is is fullscreen mode

steps.description: Check if the presenter console is visible
steps.expected: The presenter console is correctly integrated as a core feature in Impress

author: elebideau
